intro: Impatiens delicatula, commonly known as the delicate impatiens, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is characterized by its slender, trailing stems and small, showy flowers. The plant typically produces vibrant pink or white flowers with spurred petals, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and greenhouses worldwide.
